author: NASS
description:
I colorized, restored, and meticulously engineered the sound for this captivating video, showcasing a journey through 1940s San Francisco. The footage reveals the city's railroad tracks leading to the Southern Pacific Railroad depot, offering glimpses of historic industrial sites, bustling intersections, and vintage automobiles. Mission Bay, once a wetland, transformed into a thriving commercial hub, while the harbor comes to life with its many boats

video Restoration Process:
✔ FPS boosted to 60 frames per second 
✔ Image resolution boosted up to HD 
✔ Improved video sharpness and brightness 
✔ Colorized only for the ambiance (not historically accurate)
✔sound design added only for the ambiance
✔restoration:(stabilisation,denoise,cleand,deblur) 


B&W Video Source from: Internet Archive

Please, be aware that colorization colors are not real and fake, colorization was made only for the ambiance and do not represent real historical data.
title: 1940s California in Color – San Francisco [60fps,Remastered] w/sound design added
